newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: BIRZAI DAIRY NOT TO PAY DIVIDENDS.
newsitem.headline: BIRZAI DAIRY NOT TO PAY DIVIDENDS.

text.p: Lithuania's Birzai Dairy said on Tuesday that it would not pay dividends and that it would use its 1996 profits to upgrade its production lines.
The company earlier reported that its 1996 audited net profit had fallen to 2.2 million litas from 2.36 million litas the previous year.

"We decided not to pay any dividends at the general shareholders' meeting on Saturday, and to use the money to develop our production and upgrade lines," the dairy's general director, Vladas Songalia, told Reuters.
"If we suceed to expand our market, and to provide a new range of products, we shall think about increasing our share capital by $6.0 million," he added.
The company's share capital is currently 43 million litas.
It boosted its share capital by 24 million litas last year with the issue of a 24 million litas gross depository receipt (GDR) issue, the first by a Lithuanian company outside the banking sector.
Songaila would not say if the company would use another GDR in 1997 to raise its share capital but said that any increase would be done by issueing shares abroad.
The company exports 50 percent of its product and wants to grab a 25 percent share of the Lithuanian market this year. It currently has a 15 percent share of the market, Songaila said.
